name: AzureIoTEdge
description: Build and deploy an Azure IoT Edge image
author: Microsoft Corporation

groups.name: advanced_deploy
groups.visibleRule: action = Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select an Azure IoT Edge action.
 **Build module images** will only build modules (You can use it to check compilation error).
 **Push module images** will push modules to container registry.
 **Deploy to IoT Edge devices** will deploy the generated deployment file to IoT Hub. (We recommend to put **Deploy** task in release pipeline).

inputs.name: deploymentFilePath
inputs.label: Deployment file
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the deployment json file.
 If this task is in **release pipeline**, you need to set the location of deployment file in artifact.(The default value works for most conditions).
 If this task is in **build pipeline**, you need to set it to the path of **Path of output deployment file**.

inputs.name: connectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure subscription contains IoT Hub
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an **Azure subscription** that contains IoT Hub

inputs.name: iothubname
inputs.label: IoT Hub name
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: deploymentid
inputs.label: IoT Edge deployment ID
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Input the **IoT Edge Deployment ID**, if ID exists, it will be overridden.
 Up to 128 lowercase letters, numbers and the following characters are allowed [ -:+%_#*?!(),=@;' ].
 Check more information for [Azure IoT Edge deployment](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment)

inputs.name: priority
inputs.label: IoT Edge deployment priority
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Set the **priority** to a positive integer to resolve deployment conflicts: when targeted by multiple deployments a device will use the one with highest priority or (in case of two deployments with the same priority) latest creation time.
 Check more information for [Azure IoT Edge deployment](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment)

inputs.name: deviceOption
inputs.label: Choose single/multiple device
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose to deploy to single or multiple(by tags) devices
inputs.visibleRule: action == Deploy to IoT Edge devices

inputs.name: targetcondition
inputs.label: IoT Edge device target condition
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Input the **target condition** of devices you would like to deploy. Do not use double quote. Example: **tags.building=9 and tags.environment='test'**.
 Check more information for [Azure IoT Edge deployment](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/iot-edge/how-to-deploy-monitor#monitor-a-deployment)

inputs.name: containerregistrytype
inputs.label: Container registry type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select a **Container Registry Type**.
 **Azure Container Registry** for ACR and **Generic Container Registry** for generic registries including docker hub.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a generic **Docker registry connection**. Required for **Build and Push**.

inputs.name: templateFilePath
inputs.label: .template.json file
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build module images || action = Push module images || action = Generate deployment manifest
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path of Azure IoT Edge solution **.template.json**. This file defines the modules and routes in Azure IoT Edge solution, file name must end with **.template.json**

inputs.name: defaultPlatform
inputs.label: Default platform
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build module images || action = Push module images || action = Generate deployment manifest
inputs.helpMarkDown: In your **.template.json**, you can leave the modules platform unspecified. For these modules, the **default platform** will be used.

inputs.name: fillRegistryCredential
inputs.label: Add registry credential to deployment manifest
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add registry credential for pushing docker images to deployment manifest

inputs.name: deploymentManifestOutputPath
inputs.label: Output path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The output path of generated deployment manifest

inputs.name: validateGeneratedDeploymentManifest
inputs.label: Validate the schema of generated deployment manifest
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail this step if the generated deployment manifest does not pass schema validation. You can search `Azure IoT Edge deployment` in [JSON Schema Store](http://schemastore.org/json/) to find latest schema.

inputs.name: bypassModules
inputs.label: Bypass module(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the module(s) that you **DO NOT** need to build(or push) in the .template.json, specify module names and separate with comma.
 Example: if you have 2 modules **SampleModule1,SampleModule2** in your .template.json, you want to just build or push **SampleModule1**, then you set the bypass modules as **SampleModule2**. Leave empty if you would like to build all the modules in .template.json.
